description: From Middle English sirup, from Anglo-French sirop, from Medieval Latin siruppus, syrupus, from Arabic شَرَاب‎ (šarāb, “a drink, wine, coffee, syrup”). Compare French sirop, Italian siroppo, Spanish jarabe, jarope. Compare also sherbet.
The first known use of sirup was in the 14th century.

verbs.description: sirup (third-person singular simple present sirups, present participle siruping, simple past and past participle siruped)
